tool_description: Get app statistics from the google play store.
name: Google playstore analysis
title: Google playstore analysis

api_list.name: Compare in app sales.
api_list.description: Count the number of apps that have in app sales and the number of apps that don't have in apps sales, together with the average number of downloads.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com/comp_inapp_sales"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com/comp_inapp_sales"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Compare app downloads.
api_list.description:
A count of how many apps have the same amount of downloads.
apps have a approximate download number that is pre-grouped.
api_list.code:

url = "https://google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com/comp_app_downloads"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Least downloaded 100.
api_list.description:
A list of 100 apps that have been downloaded the least.
Not all that useful since there are a lot of apps that have zero downloads.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com/least_downloaded_100"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "google-playstore-analysis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
